A selection of my citations are designed to be questions, including designating the right and wrong answers as well as including explainations.

Here is an example of such a quiz expressed on one page. Try the quiz for yourself.

```{python, eval=FALSE, results="asis", echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
m_list = [
    'demo-slopeQ2-2'
]

for m in m_list:
    CTNS_MAKE(match=m)
    CTNS(match=m, process_support_files=True, opt_ctns = [ 
        "dynamic"
      , "quiz"
      , "random"
      , "count='1'"
      , "multiplier='5'"
    ])
```
